intro: Corydalis micrantha var. pachysiliquosa, commonly known as the broad-seeded corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant produces a distinctive, elongated seed pod that remains on the plant after flowering, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and woodland settings. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
